author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
The festival of Holi is considered an occasion when one sets aside rivalries and grudges of the past year to celebrate in a spirit of fun.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi decided to do just that on the social media platform, Twitter. From his personal handle @NarendraModi, he followed around 150 people, nearly all of them political rivals, including Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, YSR Congress chief Jagan Mohan Reddy, party detractor Shatrughan Sinha, and constant baiter AICC general secretary Digvijay Singh.

More significantly, he followed the photo-parody account @RealHistoryPics that have not held back any punches in poking fun at the high and mighty in India, including the Prime Minister.

Sources in his team confirmed that nearly 150 accounts were followed by the Prime Minister, “just because of Holi” and the spirit it invokes. Senior Congress leader and fellow Gujarati Ahmed Patel, former Minister Shashi Tharoor and Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik are also in the list of names.

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had termed Mr. Modi a “coward and psyc(h)opath” on Twitter a few months ago, while it has also become a favourite medium of many politicians to put across their political statements, many of which are against Mr. Modi. By following all these leaders on Holi, may be the PM is going by the age-old Holi dictum of disregarding such leg-pulling — bura na maano, Holi hai (do not mind, it is Holi after all).

Rahul, Sisodia, Shatrughan Sinha and Digvijay Singh figure in the list of 150 names
title: Modi follows rivals on Twitter
